last_episode_to_air.name: Yasako and Isako
last_episode_to_air.overview: Yasako comes face to face with the true nature of the Coil Domain and Michiko. Even with the support of her friends, can she save Isako?

name: Den-noh Coil
overview:
Den-noh Coil, Coil — A Circle of Children, is a Japanese science fiction anime television series depicting a near future where semi-immersive augmented reality technology has just begun to enter the mainstream. The series takes place in the fictional city of Daikoku, a hotbed of AR development with an emerging city-wide virtual infrastructure. It follows a group of children as they use AR glasses to unravel the mysteries of the half real, half Internet city, using a variety of illegal software tools, techniques, and virtual pets to manipulate the digital landscape.

Den-noh Coil, in development for over a decade, is the series director debut of Japanese animator Mitsuo Iso. It premiered on NHK Educational TV on May 12, 2007. Due to the animators involved in its production and its unusually high-profile television broadcast time slot, Den-noh Coil was highly anticipated.

episodes.name: The Children with Glasses
episodes.overview: When Yasako and Kyoko's virtual pet dog, Densuke, goes missing, Yasako procures the assistance of a detective.

episodes.name: COIL Cyber Detective Agency
episodes.overview: Yasako and Fumie ask Yasako's grandmother to cure Densuke of his potentially fatal illness. In return, Yasako must agree to an interesting, and dangerous, bargain.

episodes.name: Yuko and Yuko
episodes.overview: With Densuke back, the Mojos drop him off with Isako. After freeing him from the illegal, Isako makes an enormous mistake in trying to unlock the virtual being.

episodes.name: Daikoku City Heike Club
episodes.overview: A battle breaks out at school! During the commotion, Fumie steals a mysterious piece of data from Amasawa.

episodes.name: The Metabug Scramble Bus Tour
episodes.overview: The Hackers' Club goes on a metabug expedition over the fringes of surrounding cyberspace lead by Isako.

episodes.name: The Red Automaton
episodes.overview: Yasako and Fumie begin an investigation into Haraken and Searchmaton. Under pressure, Haraken reveals something huge to Yasako and Fumie.

episodes.name: In Action!! The COIL Detective Agency
episodes.overview: Isako once again summons an illegal with the help of the Daikoku Hackers. With Yasako and Fumie working on an unrelated case, will the virus take over?

episodes.name: The Summer Festival and a Duel
episodes.overview: Isako hatches a risky plan, and Daichi's newly rekindled friendship with Fumie may suffer as a result.

episodes.name: Michiko-san from the Other Side
episodes.overview: The kids spend a dark and stormy night telling ghost stories and playing spooky games at school. Meanwhile, Haraken has an interesting other worldly experience.

episodes.name: Kanna's Diary
episodes.overview: Following clues left by Haraken's former research partner, Haraken, Fumie, and Yasako search for any new leads.

episodes.name: Sunken! Daikoku City
episodes.overview: Daichi's plan to acquire metabugs via a fish-type illegal doesn't go as planned and may endanger everyone in the virtual vicinity.

episodes.name: Daichi Grows Hair
episodes.overview: Yasako finds a race of microscopic illegals growing on their faces that are on the brink of destruction. Can Yasako figure out a way to save them?

episodes.name: The Last Plesiosaur
episodes.overview: A docile illegal follows the kids on a hazardous journey through the city, driven to find more of its kind.

episodes.name: Record of a Living Being
episodes.overview: Akira, Fumie's little brother, recalls the events thus far from his own perspective. Later, Haraken is warned by Nekome to stop investigating.

episodes.name: The Young Boy Beyond the Station
episodes.overview: Yasako searches for the place she met 4423. Afterward, she deduces that the place was a virtual space that was deleted.

episodes.name: Isako's Hospital Room
episodes.overview: Haraken and Fumie discover early accounts from previous denno users. Later, Yasako visits her comatose brother.

episodes.name: The Final Summer Vacation
episodes.overview: Haraken asks Isako to take him to the so-called "other world" in an effort to see if Kanna Ashihara still exists.

episodes.name: The Door to Another World
episodes.overview: Haraken barely makes it back through Isako's gateway. Tamako, fearing for his life, takes his glasses away. Meanwhile, trouble begins as a space appears behind Megabaa's shop.

episodes.name: The Dark Visitors
episodes.overview: With Kyoko on the "other side", Fumie and Yasako get help from Densuke to help guide Kyoko's denno body back to her real one.

episodes.name: Kanna and Yasako
episodes.overview: Haraken uses Kanna's glasses to sneak to the "other side." Yasako also enters with the help is Isako and Tamako.

episodes.name: The Dark Automaton
episodes.overview: Megamass is doing research on the "other side" and the effects of the den-noh coil. Isako finds herself drawn into it.

episodes.name: The Final COIL
episodes.overview: Yasako and Isako are running from Megamass. While hiding, they discover that Densuke might be able to open a stable portal.

episodes.name: The Granted Wish
episodes.overview: For various reasons, Nekome wants to join her brother on the other side, and the only way is to somehow convince Densuke to help.

episodes.name: The Children Who Throw Away Their Glasses
episodes.overview: The events surrounding Isako frighten the other parents. In an effort to keep their children safe, they confiscate their glasses, but at what cost?

episodes.name: The Kanazawa City Hazama Intersection
episodes.overview: Desperate to save Isako, Yasako finds a pair of glasses that belonged to her grandfather and uses them to travel to the other side.

episodes.name: Yasako and Isako
episodes.overview: Yasako comes face to face with the true nature of the Coil Domain and Michiko. Even with the support of her friends, can she save Isako?
